channel.title: Talks & Posters on Theodor Adrian Balan
channel.description: Recent content in Talks & Posters on Theodor Adrian Balan

item.title: From scripts to packages: how to be disciplined about your R code
Non-proportional hazards or unobserved heterogeneity in clustered survival data: Can we tell the difference?
item.description:
I gave talks on this subject at the following events:

  • IBS Channel Network Conference 2017, 24-26 April 2017, Hasselt, Belgium
  • 9th EMR-IBS and Italian Region Conference, 8-12 May 2017, Thessaloniki, Greece

item.title: Dynamic frailty models for recurrent events data
item.description:
I gave talks on this subject at the following events:

  • Avoiding Bias induced by Design and Analysis in Life History Cohort Studies, 21-23 September, Freiburg, Germany
  • Population-based Time-to-event Analyses, 31 August â€“ 2 September, London, UK
  • 28th International Biometric Conference, 10-15 July, Victoria, Canada
